results.title: Railways of Australia
results.creator_credit: Cinesound Movietone, Commonwealth Railways, Frank Killian and William M. Carty
results.brief_description: Surveys the railway system in Australia today, and the need for its maintenance and improvement to meet the ever-increasing calls for all forms of quick and efficient transportation. Stresses the importance of railways for carrying large numbers of people and raw materials.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cinesound Movietone, Commonwealth Railways, Frank Killian and William M. Carty

results.title: Railways for ever
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films and Norman Prouting
results.brief_description: The last steam train crossing the Pennines and an Edwardian concert hall song “Watching the trains go out”, bring back many memories to Sir John Betjeman. In his own nostalgic verse and prose, he remembers the great trains of old and looks forward to railways for ever as he moves through a photographic exhibition.

results.title: Railways at work
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Malcolm Otton and Bern Gandy
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Transport in Australia”.
Shows the vital role of railways in Australia’s economy. Includes scenes from each state to illustrate rolling stock, services and people who depend on railways, directly or indirectly.

results.title: Railway worker
results.brief_description: Brief scenes of railway workers in New Zealand at work in the many essential jobs of the system, with impressions of life in isolated railway communities.

results.title: Railway Centenary Exhibition
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films of India, M. Bhavnani and Jagat Murari
results.brief_description: The Rialway Centenary Exhibition was organised in Delhi as a fitting memorial to the saga of Indian railways. Glimpses of the manifold achievements of Indian railways, including the Chittaranjan Locomotive Workshops, the Integral Coach Factory near Madras and TELCO at Jamshedpur.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Documentary Films of India, M. Bhavnani and Jagat Murari

results.title: Railroaders
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB and Guy L. Cote
results.brief_description: A film about winter railroading in the Canadian Rockies and the men who keep the lines clear. The stretch between Revelstoke and Field, British Columbia, is a snow-choked threat to communications. The film shows the work of section hands, maintenance men, train crews and telegraph operators. (Award: Locarno)

results.title: Rail town
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Joan Long and Eric Thompson
results.brief_description: Dramatises the activities and life of the people of Port Augusta, South Australia, with emphasis on the significance of this city as a railhead linking the Eastern States with the West and the Northern Territory.

results.title: Raiders of the top end
results.brief_description: A factual and exclusive account of the mainland activities of Exercise Kangaroo 89 which tested the ability of the Australian Defence Force to operate in and defend against terrorist style attack the vast, remote and sparsely populated region of Australia’s Top End. The program graphically captures the reality of how the threats and attacks by effective Kumarian enemy raiding parties were dealt with. It won a gold camera award and a certificate of creative excellence at the USA Film and Video Festival in Chicago 1990.
